summary:
### Material Information Summary (Exploration Update):

- **Key Findings**:
  - **Gallium (Ga₂O₃) Drill Intercepts**:
    - 285m @ 23.7 ppm (LEDD_08)  
    - 197m @ 22.8 ppm (LEDD_10)  
    - 120m @ 29.1 ppm (LERC_54)  
  - **Rutile (TiO₂) Drill Intercepts**:
    - 285m @ 0.42% (LEDD_08)  
    - 120m @ 0.51% (LERC_28)  
    - 108m @ 0.50% (LERC_45)  
  - Metallurgical samples averaged up to **25.5 ppm Ga₂O₃** and **0.61% TiO₂**.

- **Exploration Targets**:
  - **Gallium**: 190–195Mt @ 20–25 ppm Ga₂O₃ (3,800–4,875 tonnes contained Ga₂O₃).  
  - **Rutile**: 190–195Mt @ 0.3–0.5% TiO₂ (570,000–975,000 tonnes contained TiO₂).  

- **Market Context**:
  - Gallium price: **~AUD1,600/kg** (USD1,044/kg).  
  - Rutile price: **~AUD2,500/t** (USD1,635/t).  
  - Potential to reduce reliance on China for critical minerals (graphite, gallium).

- **Next Steps**:
  - **CSIRO** testing to identify gallium mineral hosts (LA-ICP-MS analysis).  
  - **IMO** metallurgical test-work for rutile extraction (flotation/gravity methods).  
  - Leliyn graphite scoping study completion expected **this quarter** (excludes rutile/gallium revenue).  

**No material capital, trading, or operational financial data disclosed.**  
**No new Mineral Resources estimated for gallium/rutile; targets remain conceptual.**
